1.name: fists
1.effect: On a High Roll move the target 1 tile of your choosing.

2.name: dagger
2.effect: On a High Roll give the target an additional 1 stack of Bleed.

3.name: great hammer
3.effect: This weapon does Double Damage to objects. On a Low Roll this weapon does half damage to objects instead of double. On a High Roll Knockback the Target 2 tiles away from you.

4.name: hand crossbow
4.effect: On a High Roll do an additional 1 Damage.

5.name: boomerang
5.effect: On a Low Roll you don't catch the Boomerang and it flys 4 tiles behind you. On a High Roll give the target 1 stack of Stun.

6.name: lanturn
6.effect: Instead of doing damage this weapon gives stacks of Burn equal to its Damage. On a Low Roll you gain 1 Marked. On a High Roll give the target 1 stack of Marked.

7.name: shovel
7.effect: On a High Roll you can throw dirt into the Target's eyes to give them 1 stack of Blind.

8.name: short sword
8.effect: On a Low Roll do 1 less Damage. On a High Roll do an additional 1 Damage.

9.name: long sword
9.effect: On a Low Roll do 1 less Damage. On a High Roll do an additional 1 Damage.

10.name: axe
10.effect: On a Low Roll do 1 less Damage. On a High Roll do Double Damage to Armor

11.name: spear
11.effect: On a Low Roll you have a Range of 1 instead of 2. On a High Roll you damage Target's in a line in front of you instead of just the first Target hit.

12.name: short bow
12.effect: On a Low Roll you do 1 less damage to Armor Health. On a High Roll you reduce the Target's speed by 1 until the start of your next Turn. This effect does not Stack.

13.name: crossbow
13.effect: On a Low Roll do 1 less damage. On a High Roll do an additional 1 Damage.

14.name: popshard rifle
14.effect: On a Low Roll do 1 less Damage. On a High Roll do Double Damage to Armor

15.name: rapier
15.effect: On a Low Roll loose 1 speed until the start of your next Turn. On a High Roll you may Move 1 tile.

16.name: popshard revolver
16.effect: On a High Roll, roll a dice. If you roll less than or equal to the number of rounds left in this weapon, you may do another Attack with this weapon without spending more dice.

17.name: popshard lever action repeater
17.effect: On a High Roll, roll a dice. If you roll less than or equal to the number of rounds left in this weapon, you may do another Attack with this weapon without spending more AP.

18.name: popshard shotgun
18.effect: Hits Target's to the left and right of the target you aimed at. On a Low Roll only hits 1 target. On a High Roll it attacks in a Cone in front of you.

19.name: whip
19.effect: On a High Roll give the target an additional 1 stack of Bleed.

20.name: shard blade dagger
20.effect: On High Roll give the target an additional 1 stack of Burn.

21.name: shard infused staff
21.effect: On a Low Roll have 1 less Range. On a High Roll give the target 1 stack of Stun

22.name: yoyo
22.effect: On a High Roll you may cast a spell through the Yoyo having it originate from the location of the Yoyo, so long as you are holding onto the string.

23.name: bronze bolter
23.effect: On a Low Roll the weapon jams; do not autoload at the end of the turn. On a High Roll do half damage (rounded up) twice to the target. This attack hits twice but only costs 1 loading shot.

24.name: steamthrower
24.effect: Attacks all Target's in a Line. Instead of doing damage this weapon gives stacks of Burn equal to its Damage. On a Low Roll have 1 less Range. On a High Roll have 1 more Range.

25.name: clockwork cannon
25.effect: Attacks hit in a Burst 1 shape. On a Low Roll the weapon jams; do not autoload at the end of the turn. On a High Roll give all Target's 1 stack of Bleed.

26.name: bite
26.effect: On High Roll give the target an additional 1 stack of Bleed.

27.name: peck
27.effect: On High Roll give the target an additional 1 stack of Blind.

28.name: lick
28.effect: On High Roll move the target 1 tile closer.

29.name: kick
29.effect: On a High Roll move the target 1 tile of your choosing.

30.name: soul weapon
30.effect: Increases its damage by 1 every 2 levels you have. On a High Roll Knockback the Target 2 tiles away from you.

31.name: spirit claws
31.effect: Increases its damage by 1 every 2 levels you have. On a High Roll give the target 1 stack of Soul Strain.

48.name: bandage
48.effect:
Target a Creature, cannot target undead or constructs. Roll Medicine, 7+ Heal the target half your Medicine (rounded up).
Can be crafted with medicine or crafting Rolls.

49.name: medkit
49.effect:
Target a Creature, cannot target undead or constructs. Roll Medicine, 7+ Heal the target for your medicine.
Can be crafted with medicine or crafting Rolls.

50.name: healing spray
50.effect:
requires medicine 3 to be used properly. Target a Creature, cannot target undead or constructs. Heal the target 2 + your Level Health.
Can be crafted with medicine or crafting Rolls.

51.name: smoke grenade
51.effect: Throw Range 6. Cast Conjure Fog wherever it lands. The fog ends when the spell runs out, this spell cannot be countered or stopped early.

52.name: frag grenade
52.effect: Throw Range 6. Burst 1 centered wherever it lands. Target's within the area take 2 damage.

53.name: flashbang
53.effect: Throw Range 6. Cast lightshow wherever it lands. Using the 2 dice given plus 4 for the sum.

54.name: potion of cold resistance
54.effect: You take half damage from Water spells, and reduce stacks of Stun by 1 when gaining stacks of Stun. This effect lasts for 1 minute (6 turns).

55.name: potion of fire resistance
55.effect: You take half damage from Fire spells, and reduce stacks of Burn by 2 instead of 1 when you remove stacks of Burn. This effect lasts for 1 minute (6 turns).

58.name: holy water
58.effect: Deals 1 damage to Undead when in contact (this does not remove the Holy water). This is needed to craft a potion of Life.

59.name: weak sleeping poison
59.effect: When ingested or put into the blood (coated blade) if you have 5 or less Health you Fall Asleep. The GM rolls a dice, you are asleep for this many hours or until someone wakes you up with damage or ## (2 dice).

60.name: weak poison
60.effect: When ingested become Poisoned for 1 minute. When applied to a weapon the duration is reduced to 12 seconds (2 turns).

61.name: weak soul rend poison
61.effect: When ingested or put into the blood (coated blade) gain 2 Soul Strain.

62.name: weak paralysis poison
62.effect: When ingested or put into the blood (coated blade) gain 1 Stun.

63.name: potion of stoneskin
63.effect: Gain reduce all damage taken by 1 for 30 seconds (3 turns).

64.name: potion of flight
64.effect: Gain Flight (Can move its speed in the air) for 1 minute (6 turns).

65.name: haste potion
65.effect: In combat when you roll your turn dice, get an additional 3. Outside of combat you gain 2 speed. This effect lasts for 30 seconds (3 turns).

66.name: potion of heart
66.effect: Gain 4 Max Health. This goes away at the end of the next rest.

70.name: potion of life
70.effect:
Revive a dead creature. The creature's Soul must be free and the creature cannot have been dead for more than 1 month.
requires a Phoenix Feather, Undying Heart, and Holy Water to craft.

71.name: acid vial
71.effect: When applied to an object reduce the objects Armor Health by 4 per turn. If you coat a weapon this effect is applied to Target's struck by it.

72.name: smiting tools
72.effect: When you do the Action Make an Item you may craft weapons and armors.

73.name: tinkers tools
73.effect: When you do the Action Make an Item you may craft complex items.

74.name: alchemist tools
74.effect:
Grants the Action Make a Potion which uses Arcana:
5+ Spend 1 minute and half the gold cost of a potion to create a potion of Crafting value 0.
7+ Spend 10 minutes and half the gold cost of a potion to create a potion of Crafting value 1 or less.
14+ Spend 10 minutes and half the gold cost of a potion to create a potion of Crafting value 2 or less.
21+ Spend multiple hours and half the gold cost of a potion to create a potion of Crafting value 3 or less.
28+ Spend multiple hours and half the gold cost of a potion to create a potion of Crafting value 4 or less.

75.name: cooking tools
75.effect:
Grants the Action Cooking which can be used with Mind, Nature, or Medicine:
5+ Spend 5 minutes to create up to 3 Travel Meals from raw resources.
7+ Spend 10 minutes to create up to 3 Cheap Meals from raw resources.
14+ Spend 30 minutes to create up to 3 Decent Meals from raw resources.
18+ Spend 1 hour to create up to 3 Rich Meals from raw resources.
21+ Spend 2 hours to create up to 3 Royal Meals from raw resources.

76.name: thieves' tools
76.effect:
Grants the Action Lockpick which can be used with Mind or Thieving:
7+ Unlock most locks.
14+ Unlock a well made lock.
21+ Unlock unique locks.
28+ Unlock magical locks.

77.name: navigational tools
77.effect:
Grants the Action Chart a Course which can be used with Mind or Nature:
7+ Know where you are and know the general direction of where you want to go.
14+ Know where you are and find a direct safe path to where you want to go.
21+ Know where you are and find a direct safe path, and a risky path to where you want to go.
28+ Know where you are and the local environment as if you had lived here all your life.

78.name: instrument
78.effect:
Grants the Action Performance: Play a Song which can be used with Soul or Charm:
6- Everyone boo's you and tries to get you to stop playing.
7+ Play a song to rouse common people, commoners will watch you perform. You may get some coin at the end.
14+ Play a song to rouse most people, most will watch you perform. You may get some coin at the end.
21+ Play a song to rouse nobility, nobles will watch you perform. You may get some coin at the end.
28+ Play a song to rouse royalty, royals will watch you perform. You may get some coin at the end.

79.name: small bag
79.effect: Increases items that can be carried by 1/2th [4 bits] of a tile.

80.name: backpack
80.effect: Increases items that can be carried by 1 tile [8 bits].

81.name: cart
81.effect: Can carry 1*2*2 [32 bits] (width, length, height) tiles of stuff.

82.name: wagon
82.effect: Allows for crafting while traveling, and can carry 2*4*6 [384 bits] (width, length, height) tiles of stuff.

83.name: row boat
83.effect: Can carry 1*2*2 [32 bits] (width, length, height) tiles of stuff. Only works in water.

84.name: big boat
84.effect: Allows for crafting while traveling, and can carry 2*4*6 [384 bits] (width, length, height) tiles of stuff. Only works in water.

86.name: fire starters
86.effect: Can start a fire without rolling Nature.

87.name: travel supplies
87.effect: Contains all the necessities for travel excluding food, including Cooking tools. Fire starters, a Bedroll, a Lanturn, and 10 tiles of Rope (50 ft)

88.name: travel meal
88.effect: An assortment of dry goods meant for travel. It does not taste good.

89.name: cheap meal
89.effect: A prepared meal. It's better than Travel Meal but not by much.

90.name: decent meal
90.effect: A well prepared meal. Most will find this acceptable.

91.name: rich meal
91.effect: An expensive meal made for the wealthy. Most will find this tasty.

92.name: royal meal
92.effect: Kings and Emperors eat this. The best meal money can buy.

93.name: map
93.effect: A map. Gives a bonus dice when using Navigational Tools or when doing a Remember roll to find out where you are.

94.name: oil
94.effect: Flammable. Can be used to refuel a Lantern or for cooking.

95.name: phoenix feather
95.effect:
A golden orange feather that is warm to the touch.
If a Creature dies while in possession of the feather the feather turns to dust, the creature's Health is set to 1, and they are no longer on Death's Door.
This is needed to craft a potion of Life.

96.name: undying heart
96.effect:
A heart that continues to beat even when its body is lost.
Can be Consumed to permanently increase Health by 2.
This is needed to craft a potion of Life.

97.name: rune of power
97.effect:
Makes the object give off a feeling of power.
Weapon: Attacks do an additional 2 Damage, and reduces the High and Low Roll threshold by 2.
Armor: Increase the amount of Armor Health or Dodge by 1. (Armor health that would give 2*Level gives 3*Level instead)
Item: Can be activated with a # (one dice) to give the user an additional dice on their next roll. This can be done 4 times per day with this Rune. Resetting at Dawn.

98.name: rune of swiftness
98.effect:
Makes the object seem blurry.
Weapon: Attacks gain +1 to the sum of the roll.
Armor: Increases the users Speed by 1.
Item: Can be activated with a # (one dice) to give the user an additional 2 Speed for 1 minute. This can be done 4 times per day with this Rune. Resetting at Dawn.

99.name: rune of fire
99.effect:
Makes the object warm to the touch.
Weapon: Attacks apply an additional 2 stacks of Burn. On Low Roll gives 1 stack instead. On High Roll gives 3 stacks instead.
Armor: You take half damage from Fire spells, and reduce stacks of Burn by 2 instead of 1 when you remove stacks of Burn.
Item: Can be activated/deactivated with a # (one dice) to make the item super hot the rune will never heat up the item to the point of melting or burning but it will get close.

100.name: rune of ice
100.effect:
Makes the object cold to the touch.
Weapon: Attacks apply an additional 2 stacks of Stun. On Low Roll gives 1 stack instead. On High Roll gives 3 stacks instead.
Armor: You take half damage from Water spells, and reduce stacks of Stun by 1 when gaining stacks of Stun.
Item: Can be activated/deactivated with a # (one dice) to make the item super cold the rune will never cool down the item to the point of freezing but it will get close.

101.name: rune of air
101.effect:
Makes the object feel lighter.
Weapon: Attacks do half damage (rounded down) to another creature of your choice within 1 tile of the creature hit. On Low Roll does 1 less damage to the other creature. On High Roll can damage 2 creatures within 1 tile instead of 1.
Armor: You take half damage from Wind spells, and reduce damage from projectiles by 1.
Item: Can be activated/deactivated with a # (one dice) to make the item give off a soft breeze.

102.name: rune of earth
102.effect:
Makes the object feel heavier.
Weapon: Attacks give an additional 2 Knockback. On Low Roll does 1 less Knockback. On High Roll gives 2 more Knockback.
Armor: You take half damage from Earth spells, gain an additional Armor Health equal to your Level.
Item: Can be activated/deactivated with a # (one dice) to make the item Indestructible to any Non-Earth Spell.

103.name: rune of light
103.effect:
Makes the object glow slightly.
Weapon: Attacks apply an additional 2 stacks of Marked. On Low Roll gives 1 stack instead. On High Roll gives 3 stacks instead.
Armor: You take half damage from Light spells, you cannot gain stacks of Blind.
Item: Can be activated/deactivated with a # (one dice) to make the item light up as if the spell Fog Light was cast on it.

104.name: rune of dark
104.effect:
Makes the object seem to be covered in shadow.
Weapon: Attacks apply an additional 2 stacks of Blind. On Low Roll gives 1 stack instead. On High Roll gives 3 stacks instead.
Armor: You take half damage from Dark spells, you cannot gain stacks of Mark.
Item: Can be activated/deactivated with a # (one dice) to make the item turn Invisible.

105.name: rune of spell resistance
105.effect: When you have to roll dice when saving against a spell you can add 3 to the spell sum.

106.name: rune of hunger
106.effect: You can spend 1 dice to activate or deactivate this rune. While active You take 1 damage at the end of your turn; but you Heal 1 each time you hit a creature with the weapon inscribed with this rune.

107.name: rune of chaos
107.effect: When doing an action if you roll a 6 turn another non 1 or 6 into a 6. When rolling a 1 turn another non 1 or 6 into a 1.

108.name: rune of the darkness
108.effect: While you are in the dark you do an extra 2 Damage.

109.name: rune of souls
109.effect: Increases the Users Max Soul Strain by 1.

110.name: rune of heart
110.effect: On Rest gives the user an additional 3 Max Health.

111.name: rune of hostility
111.effect: When applied, name a type of creature (Humanoid, Beast, Construct, Monstrosity, Undead or Planar). The rune glows when that type of creature becomes hostile within 20 tiles of the rune. It glows brighter the closer it is to the creature, starting with a soft glow becoming a bright glow as if the spell Glow was cast on it.

112.name: rune of friendship
112.effect: When you are within 3 tiles of another person using a rune of Friendship both creatures gain 1 Dodge.

113.name: rune of glow
113.effect: You can spend 1 dice to activate or deactivate this rune. While active the rune glows as if the spell Glow was cast on it. This effect lasts until deactivated. Items with this rune can be used to cast spells through them.

114.name: rune of the feather
114.effect: Half's the weight of whatever the rune is attached to. Turns 2 handed Melee weapons into 1 handed, this action reduces damage by 1.

115.name: rune of lead
115.effect: Double's the weight of whatever the rune is attached to. Turns 1 handed Melee weapons into 2 handed, this action increases damage by 1.

116.name: rune of branding
116.effect: Attacks Mark the target until the beginning of your next turn.

119.name: dimensional bag (bag o holding)
119.effect: The Bag has the spell Pocket Dimension constantly cast on it. It is not tied to any one person and cannot be placed inside another Dimensional Bag or Pocket Dimension.

120.name: scarf of the fish's tale
120.effect: An ornate scarf decorated with a story of love lost at sea. Once tied to a user, they are able to breathe underwater and can “talk” to aquatic life.

121.name: ring of illusions
121.effect:
A ring carved with ever changing runes that seem to describe any number of lost secrets.
A creature can bind itself to the ring. Once bound to a user, they are able to cast Minor Illusion at will, and can cast Create Illusion Twice a day without gaining Soul Strain. This effect resets at the end of a Rest.

122.name: living map
122.effect:
A ebony cloth map that shows glowing gold and white details.
When the map is opened it shows a detailed map of the surrounding area (200x200 tiles). The map shows the location of any creatures in its area. It wont show hidden areas or things disguised by magic such as Invisible creatures.

123.name: cloak of shadows
123.effect:
A ebony cloth map that shows glowing gold and white details.
When the map is opened it shows a detailed map of the surrounding area (200x200 tiles). The map shows the location of any creatures in its area. It wont show hidden areas or things disguised by magic such as Invisible creatures.

124.name: enchanted weapon
124.effect:
A weapon forged by the greatest smiths.
Is found with a random rune inscribed on it. Can hold 2 runes.

125.name: parachute ring
125.effect:
A ring with a small engraving of a cloud.
When the wearer falls 5 tiles or more will cast Spectral Parachute on only the wearer. This can only be done once per day.

126.name: philosopher's stone
126.effect:
A small red/pink stone that numbs the touch.
You can convert small or tiny non-magic items into your possession into an amount of gold pieces equal to what it would cost to craft that item. Alternatively, you can turn gold into a raw non-magic item such as 3 gold to an iron ingot.

127.name: rope
127.effect: It's rope. Typically in 1 Tile increments (5 ft.)

128.name: alarm clock
128.effect: A device to tell time, which can be given an amount of time. After the given time the clock will ring loudly.

131.name: vial knife
131.effect:
Makes the object give off a feeling of power.
Weapon: Attacks do an additional 2 Damage, and reduces the High and Low Roll threshold by 2.
Armor: Increase the amount of Armor Health or Dodge by 1. (Armor health that would give 2*Level gives 3*Level instead)
Item: Can be activated with a # (one dice) to give the user an additional dice on their next roll. This can be done 4 times per day with this Rune. Resetting at Dawn.
